betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Yellorite reactors can be upgraded into accepting water, and producing steam instead of power.
Steam is consumed by a turbine, which is a hollow cuboid of casings (with a transparent variant) that has to include a controller, two fluid ports (input for steam & output for water) and a power tap.
A rotor bearing has to be included in the middle of one of the turbine's faces.
Starting from the bearing, any number of rotor shafts, blades, and coils (blocks of metals) can be used.
